accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Before reproducing or quoting from any materials, in whole or in part, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Research Center, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were acquired by Special Collections Research Center on 05/10/2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessioned and minimally processed in May 2009 by Ute Schechter, Warren E. Burger Archivist. Further description by Terry Noziglia, SCRC Staff, in October 2009.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: State Reform and Industrial School for Girls  established in 1868; in 1878 name changed to Girls’ Industrial Home; in 1913 name changed to Girls’ Industrial School; Delaware, Ohio. Further information about this individual or organization may be available in the Special Collections Research Center Wiki: http://scrc.swem.wm.edu/wiki/index.php/Girls Industrial Home (Delaware, Ohio).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Journals of the Girls' Industrial Home, a reform school in White Sulphur, Delaware County, Ohio, 1894-1895. Recorded are daily transactions at the school, from chores and meals to visits of the chaplain and board members. The journal documents predominantly the management and administration of the reform school. Occasionally it mentions the arrivals of new girls. Also documented are arrangements for holiday meals and entertainment, supplies ordered, crockery broken, gifts received.A few pages in the front and toward the back of the journal were used in the years 1924-1929 and 1946 as a farm journal or diary for "Hillcrest," most likely in the same area, as a wedding in Rome, Delaware County is mentioned.
